question_text: A 30-year-old man is evaluated for an acute pruritic skin eruption.Skin findings are shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is allergic contact dermatitis (Option A). In acute allergic contact dermatitis, the skin is red, edematous, weepy, and crusted; there may be vesicles or bullae and intense pruritis is typically present. The pattern (round, square, linear) and location of the eruption often provide clues to the source of the allergen, such as linear patterns from brushing an arm against poison ivy.
